dishes.name: Ratatouille
dishes.description: Ratatouille is a French Provençal dish of stewed vegetables, originating in Nice, and sometimes referred to as ratatouille niçoise.

dishes.name: Trenette al Pesto
dishes.description: Basil is a cherished ingredient from the Italian region of Liguria. Combined with extra-virgin olive oil, pine nuts, Grana Padano and Pecorino, it is the backbone of pesto. Tossed with trenette, potatoes and green beans the fragrant sauce shines.

dishes.name: Beef Bourguignon
dishes.description: A beef stew braised in red wine, often red Burgundy, and beef stock, typically flavored with carrots, onions, garlic, and a bouquet garni, and garnished with pearl onions, mushrooms, and bacon.

dishes.name: Blueberry Brioche
dishes.description: A soft, fluffy structure and slightly sweet flavour. A brioche uses a what you would call very rich dough. The dough contains quite a lot of butter and eggs which give it that unique texture and flavour.

comments.comment: Anything tastes good when you're drunk 4/5
comments.author: Jose Cuervo

comments.comment: Alright, but not as good as my green eggs and ham
comments.author: Dr Seuss

promotions.name: 12 Year Anniversary
promotions.description: Come and celebrate Gusteau's 12 year anniversary this saturday! Call ahead to schedule a booking.

leaders.name: Alfredo Linguini
leaders.description: The son and heir of Auguste Gusteau. Alfredo Linguini is the current owner and Head Chef at Gusteau's.

leaders.name: Remy
leaders.description: Best friends with the Owner and Head Chef Alfredo Linguini. Remy has persevered through all odds to become a world class chef.

leaders.name: Colette Tatou
leaders.description: Colette Tatou is a prominent up and coming chef that has dedicated her life to learning and developing the french cuisine
